data.title: Pleasant Afternoon
data.text: My friend and I did this food tour on a Saturday afternoon. There were four of us taking the tour. Tyler was so nice and very informative. The highlights were Pablo's Pizza and The Rockslide. We were surprised that there were no Colorado wines at any of the venues.

data.title: Great Tour !
data.text: A very good way to appreciate many different restaurants in Grand Junction. Thanks Rebecca for the tour and for always being available by mail to organize the tour !

data.title: Best Way to get the Local Vibe
data.text: It was only the two of us who signed up to go, and he didn't turn us away due to a small turnout. It was amazing that he went through with it, even with it raining. It was the perfect way to get a feel for the main street vibe and to understand Grand Junction in general. He was very knowledgeable and we knew nothing of Colorado in general so it was really fun to hear all the cool stories! We didn't know if we had anything to do and so this was a good filler for a random weekend away from home! I highly suggest you do this because Tyler (our host) and his wife are really trying to make a difference in our lives and for the lives of the small businesses in town.

data.title: Afternoon History and Food
data.text: What a fun Saturday afternoon, learning the history of Grand Junction and trying great food in the historic main street.  Well worth the time spent enjoying this fun town.  Winter months the little shops shut down at 5:00 pm and most are not open on Sunday.  For a moment I thought we were back in Utah.  LOL  I would of loved to check out some of the shops after the food tour.  Our Tour Guide Julia was fun and we totally enjoyed her company and stories of Grand Junction.

data.title: Fun, Fun
data.text: Totally enjoyed the day with Rebecca and Tyler what a great experience. We brought our teenage son and he had  great time too....totally worth it....

data.title: A Great Evening with Friends and Fabulous Food!
data.text: GJ Food Tours are a must for anyone wanting a fun food adventure while strolling the lovely downtown promenade and learning a bit about local history. Every tour is different, so don't be reluctant to book more than one.  Participants can learn how to taste high quality olive oils (yes, there is a technique!) and various infused balsamic vinegars at Bella Balsamic, try a variety of tasty dishes at the Nepal Indian restaurant, and enjoy beer samples with salmon fish and chips at the Rockslide Brewery.  All of these experiences were enjoyed at just one tour.  Other tours include different, but equally awesome places to dine as you enjoy the company of the host and hostess and other participants.  You pay for the tour with a reasonable, flat fee that includes all food and gratuities.  A sure winner!

data.title: Great way to spend a Saturday afternoon!
data.text: We live in GJ but had a friend come visit from out of town.  It was so much fun! This will be our new "go to" activity when we have company come visit.  Tyler & Rebecca were so fun and very knowledgeable about downtown GJ.  It was a great way to check out Main Street and try some great food!

data.title: Super fun night out
data.text: My girlfriends and I had a great time with Tyler and Rebecca Jones on the Grand Junction Food Tour. What an affordable way to have a fun night out and learn more about local history and local restaurants. Would highly recommend!

data.title: Ptarmigan Vineyards at 31 3/10 rd....the very best!
data.text: If you are looking for a great spot for a wine tasting....and some of the best white wines in the States... Ptarmigan Vineyards is your tasting spot... just down the road from the Colorado State University Experimental Farm too.... love the Riesling.... it is like going to the Rhine!!   You can not imagine the taste... and the ranking too... I would say you will need space in your vehicle to haul away your cases for special dinners.... love, love, love....we will be back... it is fun to find as well... just keep track of your road numbers!

data.title: Wonderful experience from beginning to end
data.text: I researched this tour as an activity for some friends we were meeting with in Grand Junction.  I asked numerous questions by email and Rebecca was gracious in providing answers.  We all keep dietary laws and this was readily accommodated.  The tour requires some walking (about a mile) and navigating a flight of stairs (I think there was a back elevator if needed).  Since some of us were not as young as we once were, the pace was slower to allow for that.  We had plenty of good food and learned about the history of Grand Junction.  It was an enjoyable night for all of us.  I know that all of us are planning to revisit at least one of the restaurants we sampled.  I would highly recommend this outing for any group of friends, foodie or not.  You will come away full and with additional knowledge of Grand Junction and good memories of high end food and drink.

data.title: Best of the West
data.text:
The tour organizers were well organized and prepared. The tour started on time and moved along at an engaging but leisurely pace. Great mix of food, local lore, and culture.  Lots of little surprises along the way (I won't spoil it for you). 

Great time & solid travel value.

data.title: Girls Night Out
data.text: What a wonderful evening... and educational too! I have lived in Grand Junction for almost 25 years and did not know even half of the information our tour guide presented about downtown Grand Junction. It was fun visiting so many of the downtown restaurants and sampling their food and drinks. Best Margaritas in town! We had excellent service and just an overall great experience. I promise to be back!

data.title: Great Evening!
data.text: What a great experience! The food was amazing and the history of downtown Grand Junctuon was great! A MUST for locals or visitors! Very affordable and fun!

data.title: Coffee at Roasted
data.text: Excellent family coffee shop. Great place to tale your family and animals. Everyone is so very friendly and helpful.

data.title: Fun!
data.text: A fantastic snapshot of the western slope's hospitality and history. What a fun filled evening,exploring Grand Junction's downtown gems, with friends and visitors alike. A must do and totally affordable.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: What a great night! The food and company were amazing. Everything was very well done, and we really had a lovely evening. I would recommend it to anyone.

data.title: So fun! A great night out!
data.text: Tour downtown Grand Junction with food, fun, and history! Truly a different night out. You won't be disappointed! Hosts were fun, polite and informative. Food amazing! Venues unusual, interesting and delicious!

data.title: Food fun and laughter
data.text: This was my first time ever going on a food your and it was such a blast. The good was amazing and I left feeling stuffed! It was great to share a night with friends but also meet new friends. The hosts provided us with so many fun interesting facts about the history of downtown grand junction. I would highly recommend trying this! Whether you are looking for a fun night out on the town, have family or friends from out of town, or you are visiting grand junction this would be a great thing to do!

data.title: Something fun in GJ!
data.text: A few weeks ago I was invited to participate in the Grand Junction Food Tour on a Thursday evening. The attendees met around 5pm at a downtown location for coffee and to view some local art. The hosts of the tour were so welcoming and polite and introduced everyone in the group to each other (since we would be spending the next 3 hours with people we didn't know). In total, we visited 6 different restaurants, receiving at least one sampling of food or drink at each location. The staff at all places were generous and informative. The whole tour consisted of walking from place to place, but along the way we were fascinated by facts and history of downtown Grand Junction. By the end of the night, I was extremely full of delicious food (including dessert) all for an unbelievably affordable price! I absolutely loved everything about the evening; the learning, the food, the socializing, and most importantly the experience of spending a night in a downtown that I've loved my whole life.
